channel.title: Pirate Radio
channel.itunes:author: Your friend
channel.description: Love the New Yorker? Try this!

item.creator: By Adam Gopnik
item.title: Eclipsed in his Era, Bayard Rustin Gets to Shine in Ours
item.author: By Adam Gopnik
item.content: The civil-rights mastermind was sidelined by his own movement. Now he’s back in the spotlight. What can we learn from his strategies of resistance?
item.contentSnippet: The civil-rights mastermind was sidelined by his own movement. Now he’s back in the spotlight. What can we learn from his strategies of resistance?

item.creator: By Rivka Galchen
item.title: Reinventing the Dinosaur
item.author: By Rivka Galchen
item.content: “Life on Our Planet,” a new Netflix nature documentary, renews our fascination with our most feared and loved precursors.
item.contentSnippet: “Life on Our Planet,” a new Netflix nature documentary, renews our fascination with our most feared and loved precursors.

item.creator: By Michael Schulman
item.title: Ridley Scott’s “Napoleon” Complex
item.author: By Michael Schulman
item.content: Does the director of “Alien,” “Blade Runner,” and “Gladiator” see himself in the hero of his epic new film?
item.contentSnippet: Does the director of “Alien,” “Blade Runner,” and “Gladiator” see himself in the hero of his epic new film?

item.creator: By Ed Caesar
item.title: The Kingpin Who Kidnapped Migrants for Ransom
item.author: By Ed Caesar
item.content: An Eritrean trafficker promised to help Africans desperate to reach Europe—then brutalized them inside a Libyan compound while extorting their families back home. With his fortune, he partied in Dubai.
item.contentSnippet: An Eritrean trafficker promised to help Africans desperate to reach Europe—then brutalized them inside a Libyan compound while extorting their families back home. With his fortune, he partied in Dubai.

item.title: Why Maui Burned
item.description: Lahaina’s wildfire was the deadliest in the U.S. in more than a century. Now the community is grappling with the botched response as it tries to rebuild.
item.author: By Carolyn Kormann

item.title: In the Cities of Killing
item.description: The Hamas massacre, the assaults on Gaza, and what comes after.
item.author: By David Remnick

item.title: Will the U.A.W. Strike Turn the Rust Belt Green?
item.description: A historic walkout against the Big Three automakers could shape the trajectory of one of America’s most politically salient regions.
item.author: By Dan Kaufman
